sentence.text: ï»¿Patient 5 was a 14-month-old girl referred to genetic clinic for enlarged ventricles and hydrocephalus.
She was born after a full-term uncomplicated pregnancy.
Her mother, G2P1, had an abortion due to fetal hypoplasia.
Her birth weight was 2150 g and neonatal respiratory distress was noticed.
During her visit to genetic clinic, her height was 64 cm.
Physical examination showed a relative macrocephaly, triangular face, presence of lower eyelid fat pads, upturned nose, low nasal bridge, short fingers and limbs, and enlarged abdomen.
She had developmental delay and could not walk at the age of 14 months.
